div.head: [Diary of Yun Ch'i-ho, January 6, 1892]
div.p:
In the Soph. Bib. Class Dr. CCandler, W. A. (William Akin) in commenting on the courage and virtues of Esther gave some firm & forceful remarks. In substance he said: --
1. Riches & beauty are two things that are very rarely consecrated to God.
2. Woman's suffrage means every body's suffering. Her business is to be the queen of the home. You ask "Isn't Francis
Willard a good woman?" Yes: very good; but politics are none of her business. Isn't she smart? Yes: very smart; very she wasn't made for voting. I would rather see her in heaven than at the ballot box. (And I shall see her in heaven long before she can vote.)
